text: Paraulopus nigripinnis, the cucumber fish, is a grinner of the genus Paraulopus. It is a deep water fish found around southern Australia and New Zealand on the continental shelf at depths between 65 and 600 m.http://fishesofaustralia.net.au/home/species/4350 Their length is between 15 and 20 cm. They were first described by Günther in 1878. ==References== * * Tony Ayling & Geoffrey Cox, Collins Guide to the Sea Fishes of New Zealand, (William Collins Publishers Ltd, Auckland, New Zealand 1982) Category:Paraulopidae Category:Fish described in 1878
title: Paraulopus nigripinnis
